alert.note: Alert for Greene; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 10:40PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Marengo, southeastern Greene and southeastern Sumter Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1040 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The University Of West Alabama, or near Livingston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Livingston, Forkland, The University Of West Alabama, Duffys Bend, Bluffport, Thornhill, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Tishabee, Belmont, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Lilita, McDowell, Bellamy and Birdine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Alabama.
